intro: Hieracium fuscatiforme, commonly known as the dark-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Hieracium fuscatiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
